title: Property Tax Rebate
description_short: The Property Tax Rebate Application Period ended on October 1, 2025.

title: Property Tax Assistance Program (PTAP)
description_short: The Property Tax Assistance Program (PTAP) helps citizens on a fixed or limited income by reducing the property tax rate on their home.

title: Montana Disabled Veteran Assistance Program (MDV)
description_short: The Montana Disabled Veterans (MDV) Assistance Program helps disabled veterans or their unmarried surviving spouse by reducing the property tax rate on their home. The veteran must have 100% disability from an injury related to service.

title: Montana Elderly Homeowner/Renter Credit
description_short: The Montana Elderly Homeowner/Renter Credit program is a property tax relief program that provides a refundable income tax credit of up to $1,150.

title: Land Value Property Tax Assistance Program
description_short: The Land Value Property Tax Assistance Program for Residential Property helps residential property owners if the value of their land is disproportionately higher than the value of their home or other buildings on their land and the land has

title: Montana Unclaimed Property Search (TransAction Portal)
description_short: Search for unclaimed cash and property held by the Montana Department of Revenue and submit a free claim through the TransAction Portal (TAP).

title: Nationwide Unclaimed Property Search (NAUPA & MissingMoney)
description_short: Search for unclaimed property held by U.S. states and some Canadian provinces using the official NAUPA tools and MissingMoney multi-state search.
company_or_agency: National Association of Unclaimed Property Administrators (NAUPA)

title: Unclaimed Retirement Benefits Search (PBGC)
description_short: Search the PBGC database for unclaimed pension and retirement benefits from terminated private-sector plans where participants could not be located.

title: U.S. Government Unclaimed Money Guide (USAGov)
description_short: Official federal guide for finding unclaimed money from government sources such as tax refunds, bank failures, FHA refunds, and more, with links to the correct search tools.

title: Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP)
description_short: Helps qualifying low-income households pay winter heating bills. Eligibility based on income and household size.

title: Energy Share of Montana Emergency Energy Assistance
description_short: Provides emergency heating assistance for households facing a temporary financial crisis. Helps prevent service shutoffs.

title: Weatherization Assistance Program
description_short: Free weatherization services for eligible low-income households to reduce energy bills through insulation, air sealing, and efficiency upgrades.

title: Low-Income Weatherization Program
description_short: Energy efficiency updates for income-qualified homes including insulation, heating system repair, and energy audits.

title: Heat Pump Rebate Program
description_short: Rebates for qualifying electric heat pump installations to improve efficiency and reduce heating costs.

title: Electric Water Heater Rebate Program
description_short: Rebates for high-efficiency water heaters for residential customers.

title: Home Insulation Rebate Program
description_short: Rebates for qualifying attic, wall, and floor insulation upgrades.

title: Budget Billing Program
description_short: Averaged monthly payments to help manage seasonal bill spikes.

title: Payment Arrangements / Bill Assistance Options
description_short: Flexible payment plans to prevent disconnection and help manage overdue bills.

title: Utility Informal Complaint & Bill Dispute Help
description_short: Get help resolving disputes with regulated utilities about billing, service quality, disconnections, or meter issues through the Montana PSC informal complaint process.

title: Formal Complaint Process for Utility Issues
description_short: If an informal complaint does not resolve the issue, customers can file a formal complaint with the PSC to seek bill corrections, refunds, or other relief.

title: PSC Consumer Assistance & Mediation
description_short: PSC staff can help customers understand their rights, review utility bills, and work with utilities to resolve billing errors, credits, and payment issues.

title: Help With Energy Bills (LIHEAP)
description_short: Find out if you qualify for the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) and get links to your state office to apply for help with heating and cooling bills.
company_or_agency: USAGov / U.S. Department of Health and Human Services

title: LIHEAP State Assistance Directory
description_short: Directory of LIHEAP state and territory offices where you can apply for energy assistance and crisis help with your utility bills.

title: Help Paying for Phone and Internet (Lifeline Overview)
description_short: Federal Lifeline program overview from USAGov with information on eligibility and how to get discounted phone or internet service.

title: Lifeline Phone and Internet Discount – Apply
description_short: Apply for the federal Lifeline program to get a monthly discount on phone or internet service if you have low income or qualify through other programs.

title: U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs – Benefits
description_short: Apply for and manage VA benefits including disability compensation, pensions, education, housing, and health care. Many veterans are owed backpay or retroactive benefits.

title: Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP)
description_short: Monthly food benefits on an EBT card for eligible low-income individuals and families to help buy groceries.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Public Health and Human Services (DPHHS)

title: Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) Cash Assistance
description_short: Temporary cash assistance and work support for eligible low-income families with children, limited to 60 months in an adult's lifetime.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Public Health and Human Services (DPHHS)

title: Health Coverage Assistance (Medicaid & Healthy Montana Kids)
description_short: Apply for Medicaid, Healthy Montana Kids (HMK), and other health coverage help, including premium tax credits through the federal marketplace.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Public Health and Human Services (DPHHS)

title: Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP)
description_short: Helps pay part of winter heating bills and may assist with furnace emergencies for eligible low-income households.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Public Health and Human Services (DPHHS)

title: Best Beginnings Child Care Scholarship
description_short: Helps eligible families pay for child care through a sliding-fee scholarship so parents can work or attend school.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Public Health and Human Services (DPHHS)

title: Emergency Solutions Grant (ESG) Program
description_short: Housing assistance and supportive services for people who are homeless or at risk of homelessness to help them obtain and keep permanent housing.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Public Health and Human Services (DPHHS)

title: USDA Farm Service Agency – Montana Programs
description_short: Overview of USDA Farm Service Agency programs in Montana, including disaster assistance, commodity support, conservation, and farm loans. Start here to see what you may qualify for.

title: USDA FSA – Disaster Assistance Programs (Montana)
description_short: FSA disaster assistance programs for Montana producers affected by drought, wildfire, storms, or other disasters. May provide direct payments or cost-share help.

title: Conservation Reserve Program (CRP)
description_short: Pays farmers and ranchers to remove environmentally sensitive land from production and plant species that improve environmental health. Participants receive annual rental payments.

title: Agriculture Risk Coverage (ARC) and Price Loss Coverage (PLC)
description_short: Safety net programs that provide payments to farmers when crop revenues or prices fall below guaranteed levels. Available for many covered commodities.

title: USDA Farm Loan Programs (Direct and Guaranteed)
description_short: Direct and guaranteed loans to start, expand, or support a farm or ranch, including operating loans and ownership loans. Some debt relief and servicing options may be available.

title: Environmental Quality Incentives Program (EQIP) – Montana
description_short: Cost-share and incentives for Montana agricultural producers to install conservation practices that improve soil, water, and wildlife habitat.
company_or_agency: USDA Natural Resources Conservation Service – Montana

title: Conservation Stewardship Program (CSP) – Montana
description_short: Pays producers for maintaining and improving existing conservation practices and adopting additional activities on working lands in Montana.
company_or_agency: USDA Natural Resources Conservation Service – Montana

title: USDA RMA – Crop Insurance and Loss Claims
description_short: Information on federal crop insurance plans, coverage options, and how to file a claim for crop losses due to covered causes like drought, hail, or excess moisture.

title: Property Tax Assistance Program (PTAP)
description_short: Reduces property taxes for low-income Montana homeowners. Benefits depend on income and property value limits.

title: Disabled Veteran Property Tax Relief (MDV)
description_short: Reduces property taxes for qualifying disabled veterans and their surviving spouses. Relief amount depends on income and disability rating.

title: Montana Elderly Homeowner/Renter Credit
description_short: Refundable credit for low-income elderly Montanans to help with rent or property taxes. Claimed through the Montana tax return or TAP account.

title: Land Value Property Tax Assistance Program
description_short: Property tax relief for homeowners whose land value increased rapidly. Must apply using the LVPTARP form.

title: Special Property Tax Relief for Certain Disabled Persons
description_short: Additional tax relief for certain disabled individuals based on income and eligibility rules.

title: Montana Office of Consumer Protection – Help for Consumers
description_short: The Office of Consumer Protection investigates complaints, enforces consumer laws, and can secure refunds or restitution for Montana consumers harmed by unfair or deceptive business practices.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Justice – Office of Consumer Protection

title: File a Consumer Complaint with the Montana DOJ
description_short: File a complaint against a business with the Montana Department of Justice’s Office of Consumer Protection. Complaints can lead to refunds, contract changes, or enforcement actions and settlements.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Justice – Office of Consumer Protection

title: Tobacco Directory & Tobacco Settlement Information
description_short: Information on Montana’s participation in the national tobacco Master Settlement Agreement and related tobacco enforcement. Some funds support health and prevention programs that may benefit Montana residents.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Justice – Office of Consumer Protection

title: Blackfeet Nation – Government & Services
description_short: Blackfeet Nation government site with links to programs, services, housing, education, and assistance resources for tribal members.

title: Crow Tribe – Enrollment & Per Capita Payments
description_short: Crow Tribe enrollment and per capita office page with forms and contact info for updating records and researching missing per capita payments.

title: Crow Nation – Government & Tribal Services
description_short: Official Crow Nation government site with links to departments, programs, and services that may offer financial help, housing, and other assistance to tribal members.

title: Northern Cheyenne Tribe – Government & Services
description_short: Northern Cheyenne Tribe site with information on tribal government, services, and programs that may include housing, emergency assistance, and benefits for enrolled members.

title: Fort Peck Assiniboine & Sioux Tribes – Government & Departments
description_short: Fort Peck Tribes site listing departments and programs including housing, health, employment, and other services that may offer financial assistance or benefits to tribal members.

title: BIA Rocky Mountain Region – Tribal Services & Trust Resources
description_short: Bureau of Indian Affairs Rocky Mountain Region information on trust services, land and mineral income, and other programs that may result in payments or benefits for enrolled tribal members in Montana.
company_or_agency: Bureau of Indian Affairs – Rocky Mountain Regional Office

title: Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF)
description_short: Federal program that can forgive remaining Direct federal student loan debt after 120 qualifying payments while working full-time for eligible public service or nonprofit employers.
company_or_agency: U.S. Department of Education / Federal Student Aid

title: Income-Driven Repayment (IDR) Forgiveness & Adjustment
description_short: Under income-driven repayment plans, remaining Direct loan balances may be forgiven after 20–25 years. One-time IDR account adjustments may give extra credit toward forgiveness for some borrowers.
company_or_agency: U.S. Department of Education / Federal Student Aid

title: Teacher Loan Forgiveness
description_short: Forgiveness of up to $17,500 on certain federal loans for highly qualified teachers who work full-time for five complete and consecutive years in low-income schools or educational service agencies.
company_or_agency: U.S. Department of Education / Federal Student Aid

title: Montana Rural Health & Provider Loan Forgiveness Programs
description_short: State-supported and partner programs that offer loan repayment or forgiveness for health professionals who practice in shortage areas or underserved communities in Montana.
company_or_agency: Montana health workforce programs / partner organizations

title: Montana University System – Scholarships & Tuition Assistance
description_short: Overview of scholarships, grants, and tuition assistance available within the Montana University System, including merit-based and need-based awards.

title: Montana Tuition Assistance & Waiver Programs
description_short: State-supported tuition waivers and assistance programs for Montana residents, including veterans, Native American students, and other special categories.

title: Montana Scholarships & Financial Aid Overview
description_short: State-level overview of scholarships, grants, work-study, and other financial aid options for Montana students pursuing higher education.
company_or_agency: Montana Guaranteed Student Loan Program / related agencies

title: Scholarships & Aid for Montana Health Professions
description_short: Scholarships and educational support for Montanans training in nursing, medicine, behavioral health, and other health professions, often tied to serving in rural or underserved communities.

title: Montana Courts Public Case Lookup (Court Explorer)
description_short: Search Montana court cases to check judgments, liens, and orders that may include money owed, refunds, or surplus funds. Use this as a first step to see if there is a case in your name that might involve money.

title: Find Your Local District Court Clerk
description_short: Directory of Montana District Courts and Clerk of Court offices. Contact your local clerk to ask about unclaimed funds from civil cases, foreclosures, bonds, or other matters where money might be held in the court registry.

title: County Treasurer & Tax Sale / Tax Lien Information
description_short: Many counties handle tax lien sales and may hold surplus funds from property sales. Use this county treasurer information as a starting point to ask about surplus from tax sales or foreclosures in your county.
company_or_agency: Montana Association of Counties / County Treasurers

title: Montana-Dakota Utilities – Low-Income Assistance & Discounts
description_short: Low-income energy assistance, bill discounts, and help for customers of Montana-Dakota Utilities in Montana, including support tied to LIEAP eligibility.

title: Montana PSC – Utility Financial Assistance Programs
description_short: Overview of utility financial assistance programs in Montana, including Energy Share, weatherization, furnace repair or replacement, and help funded by Montana-Dakota Utilities and Energy West for qualifying customers.

title: City of Missoula – Utility Assistance Programs
description_short: City of Missoula utility assistance, including low-income water discounts and help for customers who qualify through the Human Resource Council or state energy assistance programs.

title: City of Billings – Utility Account Services & Payment Plans
description_short: Billings utility account services for water, wastewater, and garbage customers, including help setting up payment plans, managing accounts, and handling billing issues.
company_or_agency: City of Billings Public Works – Utility Service Center

title: Montana Electric Cooperatives – Overview
description_short: Statewide association representing 25 electric cooperatives that serve more than 400,000 Montanans. Many co-ops offer payment plans, capital credit refunds, and limited emergency assistance.

title: Montana Electric Cooperatives – Member Co-op Directory
description_short: Directory of Montana electric cooperatives so members can find their local co-op to ask about capital credits, bill assistance, and payment options.

title: Montana Department of Commerce – Business Assistance & Grants
description_short: Overview of Montana Department of Commerce programs that support small businesses, including grants, loans, technical assistance, and job creation incentives.

title: Indian Country Economic Development (ICED) Program
description_short: Grants and funding to support business development and economic growth in Montana’s tribal communities, including Native-owned businesses and tribal government projects.

title: Big Sky Economic Development Trust Fund (BSTF)
description_short: Funding for job creation and economic development projects in Montana, including business expansions and infrastructure that create new good-paying jobs.

title: Montana Main Street Program
description_short: Planning and project grants to help Montana communities strengthen and revitalize their downtowns and main street districts.

title: Export Assistance & STEP Grants
description_short: Assistance and grants to help Montana small businesses expand into international markets, including trade show support and export marketing.

title: Montana Workers' Compensation Claims & Benefits
description_short: Information on filing a workers' compensation claim in Montana, checking on an existing claim, and understanding benefits for wage loss and medical costs.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Labor & Industry – Employment Relations Division

title: Contact the Employment Relations Division (Workers' Compensation)
description_short: Contact information for Montana’s Employment Relations Division to get help with workers' comp claims, disputes, and questions about unpaid or underpaid benefits.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Labor & Industry – Employment Relations Division

title: Uninsured Employers' Fund (UEF)
description_short: Provides workers' compensation benefits to employees injured on the job when their employer does not carry required workers' compensation insurance.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Labor & Industry – Uninsured Employers' Fund

title: Montana Lottery – Unclaimed Prizes
description_short: Information about unclaimed Montana Lottery prizes. Players can check whether any winning tickets have not been claimed yet and see prize expiration rules.

title: Montana Lottery – How to Claim a Prize
description_short: Instructions for claiming Montana Lottery prizes, including where to go, how to claim by mail, ID requirements, and prize claim deadlines.

title: Montana Lottery – Check Winning Numbers
description_short: Tool to check winning numbers for Montana Lottery games, which can help players see if they have older winning tickets that have not been claimed yet.

title: Montana State Veteran Benefits – Overview
description_short: Central portal listing Montana state veteran benefits, including property tax relief, tuition waivers, veterans homes, hunting and fishing discounts, and employment resources.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Military Affairs – Montana Veterans Affairs Division

title: Montana Veterans Homes
description_short: State veterans homes in Columbia Falls, Glendive, and Butte that provide long-term care, nursing, and supportive services for eligible veterans and, in some cases, their spouses.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Military Affairs – Montana Veterans Affairs Division

title: Montana Tuition Waivers for Veterans & Guard Members
description_short: Tuition waiver programs for qualifying Montana veterans, honorably discharged service members, and National Guard members attending public colleges and universities.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Military Affairs / Montana University System

title: Hunting & Fishing License Discounts for Qualified Disabled Veterans
description_short: Reduced-fee or discounted hunting and fishing licenses for eligible disabled veterans in Montana.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Fish, Wildlife & Parks / Montana Veterans Affairs Division

title: Billings Clinic – Financial Assistance Program
description_short: Financial assistance and charity care program for eligible Billings Clinic patients. May reduce or forgive hospital bills based on income and family size.

title: Providence St. Patrick Hospital – Financial Assistance
description_short: Financial assistance program for patients receiving care at Providence St. Patrick Hospital in Missoula, including reduced or forgiven bills for qualifying low-income patients.

title: Benefis Health System – Financial Assistance
description_short: Charity care and financial assistance for Benefis Health System patients in Great Falls and the surrounding area. May cover a portion or all of eligible bills.

title: Logan Health – Financial Assistance Program
description_short: Financial assistance and charity care program for Logan Health patients in Kalispell and other locations, based on income and need.

title: Nonprofit Hospitals – Charity Care & Financial Assistance Rights
description_short: Most nonprofit hospitals must offer financial assistance or charity care to eligible low-income patients. Ask the hospital billing office for its financial assistance policy and application if you cannot afford your bill.
company_or_agency: General hospital billing / Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (info)

title: RIP Medical Debt – Medical Debt Relief Campaigns
description_short: Nonprofit that buys and forgives medical debt in bulk. Check campaigns and information to see whether there have been recent or current efforts that include Montana residents.

title: NAIC Life Insurance Policy Locator
description_short: National tool that helps people find life insurance policies and annuities that may have been issued to a deceased family member. Requests are sent to participating insurers to check for unpaid benefits.

title: Montana CSI – Life Insurance & Annuity Help
description_short: Montana Commissioner of Securities and Insurance help page for life insurance and annuity questions, including how to check on policies and file complaints about unpaid life insurance benefits.
company_or_agency: Montana Commissioner of Securities and Insurance

title: How to Contact Life Insurance Companies About Unclaimed Benefits
description_short: General guidance on gathering documents (death certificate, policy numbers, social security numbers) and contacting life insurance companies to ask about possible unclaimed benefits if you suspect a policy existed.

title: Montana Child Support Enforcement Division – Overview
description_short: Child Support Enforcement Division (CSED) helps establish, enforce, and modify child support orders, and collect past-due child support for custodial parents.
company_or_agency: Montana DPHHS – Child Support Enforcement Division

title: Apply for Child Support Services
description_short: Online and paper application options to open a case with the Child Support Enforcement Division so the state can help collect and enforce child support.
company_or_agency: Montana DPHHS – Child Support Enforcement Division

title: Child Support Payment Information & Account Access
description_short: Information on how to check child support payments, including online account access and ways to receive or send payments.
company_or_agency: Montana DPHHS – Child Support Enforcement Division

title: Montana Crime Victim Compensation Program – Overview
description_short: Pays certain crime-related costs for eligible victims, including medical bills, counseling, lost wages, and funeral expenses when other sources do not cover them.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Justice – Crime Victim Compensation Program

title: Apply for Crime Victim Compensation
description_short: Application forms and instructions for the Montana Crime Victim Compensation Program, including where to send paperwork and how to get help completing the application.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Justice – Crime Victim Compensation Program

title: Montana Office of Victim Services – Help for Crime Victims
description_short: Information and support services for crime victims in Montana, including advocacy, rights information, and help connecting to compensation, counseling, and safety planning.
company_or_agency: Montana Department of Justice – Office of Victim Services

title: Railroad Retirement Board – Benefits Overview
description_short: Information on railroad retirement, disability, and survivor benefits for eligible railroad workers and their families. Separate from Social Security.

title: Railroad Retirement Board – Online Services (myRRB)
description_short: Online services for railroad workers and beneficiaries to review benefits, check payment status, and update personal information.

title: Contact RRB About Unpaid or Missing Benefits
description_short: Contact information for the Railroad Retirement Board to ask about potential unpaid benefits, survivor benefits, or issues with missing payments.

title: NCUA – Unclaimed Deposits from Closed Credit Unions
description_short: Search tool to find unclaimed deposits from federally insured credit unions that were liquidated and closed. Includes possible refunds of shares or dividends owed to former members.

title: NCUA – Consumer Assistance for Credit Union Accounts
description_short: Information and contact options for help with credit union account problems, including questions about missing funds or accounts at NCUA-insured credit unions.

title: Montana Credit Unions – Find Your Credit Union
description_short: Directory of Montana credit unions so members can contact their institution directly about old accounts, dormant shares, and possible unclaimed funds that may not yet have gone to the state.
company_or_agency: Montana Credit Union Network / Montana Credit Unions

title: Agricultural Cooperatives – Patronage & Capital Credits
description_short: Many grain, farm supply, and ranch cooperatives return profits to members through patronage dividends and capital credits. Former members may have unclaimed checks or retained equity.

title: Montana Farmers Union – Cooperative Network
description_short: Montana Farmers Union and its network of cooperatives can help connect farmers and ranchers to local co-ops where they may have patronage dividends or capital credits.

title: Contact Your Local Co-op About Patronage & Capital Credits
description_short: If you have done business with a grain elevator, farm supply, or ranch co-op, contact their office to ask if they are holding unclaimed patronage checks or retained capital credits under your name.

title: FHA Mortgage Insurance Premium Refunds
description_short: Some homeowners who had FHA-insured loans and paid them off or refinanced may be due a refund of part of their upfront mortgage insurance premium.
company_or_agency: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD)

title: Escrow Accounts & Refunds – General Guidance
description_short: Explains how escrow accounts for taxes and insurance work and when servicers should send surplus refunds after you pay off or refinance your mortgage.

title: Contact Your Mortgage Servicer About Escrow Refunds
description_short: If you recently paid off or refinanced your mortgage and did not receive an escrow refund, contact your servicer to ask about any surplus funds they may still be holding.
